ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: (Before the end of high school): Did you more than once swipe things from stores or from other children, or steal from your parents or from anyone else?
(Before the end of high school): Did you more than once get into fights that you had started?
(Before the end of high school): Were you ever involved with Social Services (Department of Youth Protection), in trouble with the police or arrested BECAUSE OF YOUR OWN MISBEHAVIOR?
(Before the end of high school): Did you ever skip school at least twice in one year?
(Before the end of high school): Did you ever run away from home overnight?
(Since leaving or finishing school): Have you been FIRED from your job (do not take into account layoffs resulting from lack of work)?
(Since leaving or finishing school): Have you ever been arrested for anything OTHER than traffic violations?
(Since leaving or finishing school): Did you ever hit or throw things at your spouse (or partner that you were living with)?
(Since leaving or finishing school): Have you ever been in trouble at work, with the police or with your family, or had a car accident BECAUSE OF DRUGS OR ALCOHOL?
